meanings.definition: A device used to catch mice.
meanings.sent1: The mousetrap caught a mouse in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: I set up a mousetrap in the basement to catch the pesky rodents.
meanings.sent3: The mouse laughed at the mousetrap, thinking it was just a toy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a mousetrap, luring him in with its sweetness.
meanings.sent5: The mousetrap snapped shut with a loud click, trapping the curious mouse.

meanings.definition: A situation in which someone is tricked or caught.
meanings.sent1: She found herself in a mousetrap of lies and deceit.
meanings.sent2: The scam artist set up a mousetrap to catch unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent3: Getting caught in a mousetrap of excuses, he struggled to find a way out.
meanings.sent4: The mousetrap of temptation snared him before he could resist.
meanings.sent5: The web of lies was a mousetrap, ensnaring all who dared to believe.
